title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Burnaby, BC) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three people, They were typing as I was talking, and the atmosphere was friendly and formal at the same time. They each asked me questions and it took around half an hour.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us and what will you do if a conflict rises or your coworker is difficult to handle, and more questions of how would you react in the situation described. Plus, tell us your weaknesses and strengths.

title: Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Great process. Very nice interviewers with thorough questions and genuinely interested in hearing what I had to say. It was a two part process, first completing a data entry test and then conducting an interview.
Interview Questions: We have to complete a data entry test and receive a minimum score to be able to move forward with interview.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Interview was misleading. Important and relevant information pertaining to the duties of the job were left out (on purpose in my opinion). Job posting and interview were not an accurate representation of the job and management acknowledged this
Interview Questions: What software I was familiar with

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal candidate so the interview process was straight forward, I received an email to confirm my interest, followed by a zoom interview with a panel of 3 members. I just finished this interview yesterday and expect to hear back by the end of the week. I'm assuming that because I was an internal candidate, I only had to do one round of interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to manage conflicting priorities?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Got reached out by their Talent on Demand. Then after around 2 weeks, I had the second interview with the PM and team lead. Both meetings were around thirty mins.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with the situation that you need some infor from the PM but no response?

title: Lab Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: 1 Phone interview, then sent an offer letter. They really needed to hire someone fast during COVID. I was interviewed right away by the person who was the department lead. This person was very professional.
Interview Questions: What do you do if you work with someone with a difficult personality?

title: Clinical Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: After applying, HR called to discuss about availability and general HR questions later called for In-person interview. After attending the interview with manager and Senior Clinical BA. They asked me many questions about my past projects and experiences. Later manager told, you’re over qualified he said there’s another role opening in another team. He said he will refer me to that position. I told him I am interested in the opportunity that open now. I told him I told him I took day off to attend this call. If you know that am over qualified, why I was called for interview? That ended the conversation. Till now I didn’t a call from them. To PHSA management: Being a health care organization that gets paid from public taxes, you should be more responsible and accountable. I feel like I can to some scam company after listing to manager words. To the manager, if his hiring manager thinks that he’s over qualified-he wouldn’t be there to interview me. You should be ashamed of yourself with this attitude. Thanks for opportunity to express.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: In-person or online interview Panel interview Included basic interview questions plus situational questions It was about 45 min long It started with questions for the interviewee They discussed job requirements at the end
Interview Questions: What is something interesting about yourself

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: The interview questions assessed both my soft and hard skills as well as my knowledge of key health topics in BC. Overall, the interviewers had fair questions and were willing to answer my questions too
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Safety Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews, first with managers and then managers and department director. They make you complete a workplace health and safety case scenario 
Straightforward process. They mainly look for new grads entering the OHS industry.
Interview Questions:
Workplace health scenarios.
Education, career development questions.

title: Medical Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Surrey, BC) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was good I applied for Medical Laboratory Assistant position but I didn't received any response from you for about three weeks after three weeks I received message and I did interview now I am waiting for response from you I hope can received sooner.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Technical Support Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: The interview was around 30-40mins with HR. Just went through my resume, explained to them about the projects I worked on and answered 5-6 technical behavioral questions like describing a situation where you had to disagree with your college on how to work on your project?.
Interview Questions: what will you do if you face a conflict with your co-worker on how to approach or solve a technical problem?

title: Coordinator Special Initiatives Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, the first interview focusing mostly on behavioural questions and the second interview focusing on ensuring I was a good fit for the organization. It was not really hard as the work was mostly on community engagement.
Interview Questions: Conflict in the workplace, how do you manage it?

title: Telecommunications Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was through zoom, I interviewed with two people. Overall it felt more like a conversation at a coffee shop than an interview. Had lots of questions relating to telco terms, and lots of behavioural questions.
Interview Questions:
Are you good doing multiple tasks at once
Explain a time you had a disagreement with a coworker
How your resume relates to the job

title: Product Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received an email first about the interview. It was a panel interview with Director, Manager, Senior Developer and another Senior Analyst. Received an offer after a month and a half.
Interview Questions: Describe your relationship with internal and external stakeholders. How do you maintain a work-life balance? Multitasking and working under pressure Decision making SQL and Power Bi Skills

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions:
Overall process is almost a month & half , very slow unnecessarily but Interview process was a panel interview with 3 persons via zoom. Later on requested references , but I have to turn it down as they took such a long time and a follow up call. 

I felt that they weren't that serious about hiring , after even following up with references they were taking so long , manager called me up after a week of following up with references ..saying they'll finalize the decision soon and I had to mention that I have been applying to multiple positions and giving interviews. 

I didn't heard back from them and only after a month they sent me email. It's interesting that, during this time they think candidates are sitting ideal and waiting for their response and then companies are curious about the career gaps as well.
Interview Questions: It was entirely based on work experience and situation based Q's .

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: virtual interview that was held by the senior manager, project manager, director for ehealth services team.  There was only one interview held and it was for a temporary role with talent on demand.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Hired through Talent on Demand. Simple one-on-one interview. It was to be hired within Talent on Demand. Once there is a placement within PHSA available, you have to interview for that placement with the department/program manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Windows Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of Hiring Manager and multiple senior team members. A fake friendliness to the introductions, and overall seemed unpleasant to interview with. Threw me off immensely and I left with zero interest hoping I heard back from them.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the questions

title: Software Developer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: HR scheduled interview with interviewers but forgot to notify me about the interview time. Recruiter told me to hop on zoom within 5 minutes. Interview process was average, but I felt like the interviewers were not the one who read my resume since they want a person who knows AI. Nothing on my resume mentioned AI-related stuff.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1:
40-minute one-on-one phone call with someone from HR. They were very friendly and made the conversation relaxed. They effectively communicated the way PHSA's recruitment works and guided me through the next steps with transparency - I was very impressed.

Round 2:
One-hour zoom call with the Project Manager I would be working with and a Director. They had about 20mins of questions prepared, but the rest of the time was filled with my questions and some back and forth conversation. Communication on the next steps was again very clear.

Following the 2nd interview, the HR team did a reference check then emailed me an offer. 

I applied for a role that was labelled as "temporary" on the careers page. Any applications for roles labelled as temp go through the same HR team that I talked to - called Talent on Demand. The great part about this is they connect you to opportunities that might be a good fit for you. So when you have a conversation with the ToD team, it's a very general interview, and they'll use your answers to connect you to various temporary opportunities. In this way, applying for one job is applying for all of them (all temp positions). The job that I was offered was not the same as the one that I applied for, but it worked out great.

The recruitment process would likely look different if you apply for a role labelled as "permanent".
Interview Questions:
Round 1:

Q1. Tell me about yourself
Q2. Why do you want to work for PHSA?
--- Time for me to ask questions ---
Q3. What is one of your greatest strengths?
Q4. What is one weakness of yours?
Q5. What's the most complex environment you have worked in?

I asked about 20mins of questions. If I had asked fewer, I suspect there would have been more questions for me.

title: Intermediate IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I had 2 interviews, the first preliminary went well, talked about past experience and what the job was to deal with, and locations. At the end of the first interview I was told they would like a second interview, to which I agreed for following week.
The next interview started quickly with introductions, then a 30min test (I'll add some questions below), all while they were watching me on the video. After 15min I stated that the questions were hard and technically I could open up Google and give the correct answers, but I'll continue without Google.
After submitting the test, we had a formal interview asking questions about CS1000, Survivable Remote Gateway systems, Cisco programming, and past experiences of Project Coordinator and Management.
Interview Questions: What is a sip proxy server

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: I first had a 4 person panel distanced interview that was about an hour long where I was asked behavioural and situational questions followed by two take home assignments. I was given about 3 days to complete the assignment with about 6 hours warning that they were going to send me an assignment.
Interview Questions: What is a project I have been most proud of, in terms of being creative or innovative in terms of approach?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and then online interview. Standard questions regarding past experience, background and reason to apply the role. Second interview with division manager and supervisor. Mostly for behavior and situation types of questions.
Interview Questions: How did you manage conflict opinions and what was the result.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fairly informal conversation for round 1, with just the project manager. Questions were not super structured, conversation led to additional questions. After round 1, was told there would be a round 2 interview with the rest of the team.
Interview Questions:
1) Why PHSA
2) Knowledge of technical skillset using softwares and project management tools
3) What attributes I'd bring to the team

title: Business Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I previously worked in a contract role with the IMITS team, and got promoted as a full-time BA. Because it was internal and the hiring managers knew the candidates, it felt casual; however, they still asked standard technical questions for the role.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would approach conflict with a difficult stakeholder.

title: Business Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: phone interview with HR to review the basics, another 2 in person interviews (one with HR and another with the manager). relatively straightforward process with active communication and HR keeps you up to date.
Interview Questions:
walk me through your resume
why are you interested in healthcare
what skills can you contribute to the role

title: Warehouse Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Conducted over the phone.  It is fair based on your past experience as to how they relate to the job.  They ask relevant questions as to how to handle orders.
Interview Questions: How did you handle orders?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview with scenario based questions and some subject matter questions. First 10 min were used to present the assignment received 5 days ahead, which was then followed by 50 min interview. It included time to ask questions about the position as well. The interview panel was 3 people.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict at work?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone screening. Asked general question e.g. why do you want to work for PHSA. Lasted about 30 mins. Second interview was more technical. Panel of 3 took turn asking questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the public health sector

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the internal job site. I was offered an interview after 1.5 weeks. The first interview was with 3 senior PMs and the second was with the team I would be working with. The interviewers were super warm and friendly and made me feel very comfortable. The questions were non-technical in nature and were mostly behavioural.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you were overloaded on tight deadlines. How did you cope with the stress?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions:
No phone screening required. Contacted by email to schedule panel interview within 48 hours. Applied to a few positions. Received confirmation emails.  HR thanked my interest in a job I didn't apply for and asked me to attend a panel interview in under 48 hours. Email confirmations did not match jobs applied for in portal.

After accepting, contacted HR with questions you'd have during a phone screening. They were not responded to.  Other reviews state HR does not have general information. Decided not to continue with interview for job I didn't apply for because there was no discussion of anything prior to scheduling a panel interview. Informed HR. No response to emails until day of interview.

You can get an interview for a job you didn't apply for, if it's similar to what you actually applied for. They keep your information in the portal. This may not be explained to you because their thank you for your interest templates are used and sent to you to set up an interview. Other reviews state the same. Some find out during the interview, that it's for a job different from what they applied to.

No salary information. HR scheduling panel interview without phone screening and being unable to answer questions regarding position and department, prior to interview scheduled to occur in 48 hours, soured the experience.

Could be miscommunication. But no one called or emailed to want to answer questions.
Interview Questions: Didn't make it to the interview.

title: Blockchain Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
- panel interview
- interviewers were 10-15 minutes late
- very awkward wait time for interviewers to show up
- an interviewer was literally eating at a restaurant while interviewing
Interview Questions:
- behavioural questions
- technical questions

title: Pathology Reception Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I did one interview and was hired on the spot. I took the position no later realizing it wasn't the best fit for me and decided to resign because of a hostile work environment. My next place of employment would look like a respectful and team playing environment.
Interview Questions: what does responsibility look like to me

title: Human Resources Coordinator (HR Coordinator) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website. The recruitment team scheduled the interviews quickly. I had two rounds of interviews and a technical assessment. The interview questions were structured. I received the offer letter after two weeks.
Interview Questions: What are your areas of improvement?

title: Workplace Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I usually don't write reviews but can honestly say that I had the worst interview experience for this role. The Recruiter reached out to me during work hours and constantly called my phone, emailed, etc. until I had to stop my work and respond. The interview was last-minute and 5 minutes before the interview, I was spammed again even though it hadn't started yet.

They then mentioned that I would hear back within a week but it's been almost a month now and I haven't heard anything back. At this point, the position doesn't even appear desirable as the whole process was severely unorganized.
Interview Questions:
What is your career path?
Why do you want to work at PHSA?
Provide examples of the projects that you have worked on.
Why do you think you are suited for this role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: it was fine, they asked relevant questions and allowed me to ask questions at the end. I was intimidating but I felt confident by the end of the interview, despite not knowing much about the job prior
Interview Questions: How well do you work in group settings?

title: Language Services Coordinator Interview

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by HR, after a month I was contacted by the team manager and the interview was arranged with the panel of three. They were all very nice and supportive. They made me soo comfortable.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2021

Panel interview - friendly, professional, 1 hour. 
Involved recruiter and 3 leaders relevant to the role being hired for. This organization, BCCDC, is staffed by experts in their field who are passionate about their work . This team has an inspiring mission.
Interview Questions: Situational - follow the job description

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for 20 minutes. Mostly Job description and then HR questions and behavioural questions. They describe the expectation of the institute and then go over the team expectation and then ask you if that matches your expectation. The team of Talent acquisition is great with explaining the interview process. They mention all that they can offer and will ask about your salary expectation.

title: Logistics attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself wasn't complicated. The questions were straightforward. I was expected to receive a status update from the interviewer in 1 or 2 days after the interview, but I received no feedback—horrible experience. I had to email the interviewer 9 days later just for an update. Unprofessional, didn't have the decency to inform me of the decision as expected.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me a time when you worked under pressure?
2. Why do you want to work for PHSA?
3. Tell me about the role you're applying for?

title: Purchasing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions:
First, I received an email asking if I was able to participate for a in-person interview on the given date. After the confirmation, I went for the in-person interview which it was very long ( 1h10m).

There were 3 people in the interview and each one took turn and asked several behavioural and situational questions 

The staff was very friendly and receptive.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for PHSA?
Tell me more about the job you are applying for

Interview Descriptions: Standard HR + on site. Phone interview was mainly behavioral. On site was pretty easy, mostly high level questions and a mix of web design questions. Was not asked to code.

title: Leadership Role Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Unrealistically long. The entire process took over 6 months to complete. Interview questions are not only grammatically incorrect, but lack imagination and aim. This is an organization that will not be 100% transparent.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed on Skype for 45 minutes. Very easy going and friendly. They want to know more about you. It was a panel and they took turns asking me questions. Made sure I was comfortable.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions:
They wanted me to do 2.5 hours of testing (typing, Word, Excel, and Powerpoint) before they would tell me:
- Which position I was interviewing for (I had applied for several)
- Whether the position was permanent or temporary
- Whether the work was in-office or remote during COVID

I asked for more information about the position, and was told I needed to complete the tests first - despite having 15 years of related experience.
I was invited to 4 interviews with PHSA by 4 different HR reps, none of whom seemed to know anything about the jobs they were contacting me for.  I'll be pursuing employment with an organization with better hiring practices.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to do several hours of tests before we tell you which position you are interviewing for?

title: System Analyst Interview

standard process

title: Administrative Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very quick, describe yourself questions. Over the phone. Also asked about past work experience and work schedule availability. Originally spoke about a different position than the one i ended up getting hired for.

title: Statistical Analyst Interview

Screening phone interview 
Panel interview (with director, manager and senior statistician) 
1-hour knowledge examination (theoretical/coding) without access to the internet on a different day
20-minute presentation including questions and answers to the team
Interview Questions: How to manage conflicting priorities/how to ensure accuracy/difficulties and challenges

title: Healthcare Assistant Interview

title: IT Liaison Interview

title: Project Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview process - phone interview, assessment, in person interview. Landed the position within two weeks of the first phone interview. The overall interview process was an enjoyable experience.

Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with the supervisor and hiring manager. Quick brief questions and a questionnaire at the end to assess knowledge. They also asked character questions and scenario based questions. They also touched base on the cores and values of the company.
Interview Questions: How did you resolve a conflict that occurred between yourself and a patient, coworker, or supervisor?

title: Research Facilitaor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had an informal discussion with two Directors, then a follow-up formal interview with 1 other Director.  The follow-up was very efficient followed-up when the interviewer said they would. I was invited for a chat 1 month after applying, then 2 weeks later was given a formal interview and waited another 2 weeks for an offer. Overall 2 months process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you took initiative to make an improvement at your work.

title: Corporate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Two person panel made up of hiring manager and a close colleague who is frequently involved in day-to-day operations.  Both managers took turns asking questions and sharing information about the role itself.
Interview Questions: Can you give me an example of a conflict you were involved in and how you solved it?

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with my manager and he explained the good, bad and why it would be a good fit.  We talked about the challenges and it was a conversation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Thorough questions were asked about previous experience and projects that were conducted and led under my leadership. Scenario questions also posed. As well, analytical skillset questions were asked and what approach is typically used.
Interview Questions: What were previous projects led?

title: Health Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: For specific department of PHSA that uses healthcare data to provide specialized services to target demographic. After applying, was contacted for a phone interview to with general talent acquisition person to gauge general interest and qualifications, then selected for in-person panel interview on site. 3 panelists were present with different roles (epidemiologist, statistician, DBA). Panel interview commenced with generic behavioural interview questions (conflict management, time management, "Where do you see yourself in 5 years?" etc.). Technical interview portion was immediately after. Given a sheet of paper with SAS procedures and was asked what different blocks of code were trying to achieve and statistical methodology used. Company did not contact me regarding decision even after emailing them 2 weeks post-interview, and even though they confirmed me both during the interview and their email response that they would inform me of their decision.
Interview Questions: Linear regression models in SAS and their purpose

title: TOD Temporary Placement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interviewer who swayed me to choose them instead of another big employer. I was at ease. Paid more than public education sector for similar entry level temp roles. Maybe 30 minutes max.
Interview Questions: When can I start, was one question

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: They followed a standard interview questionnaire, which are the typical behavioral questions. As long as you prepared examples and answered the questions, you are good to go. Got an offer within the week.
Interview Questions: Think of a time when you had conflict with a coworker.

title: Sourcing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and shortly received an invitation to meet in-person with the hiring manager, HR personnel and team lead. I expressed that I had a strong interest in the area, but did not have the appropriate training or academic background. The first panel interview went well with usual behaviour type questions. Following the initial interview, I was invited for a 2nd interview with the same panel and another clinical coordinator. This time, I was given an assignment to analyze as a business analyst and then present my findings to the panel. The presentation and analyzed data went very well. However, it appeared that I didn't fit the needs of the team lead, who I'd be working with directly. I seemed to have made an impression on the HR personnel, hiring manager as well as the clinical coordinator. The hiring manager called me personally to follow up and asked me to consider another job that they were hiring for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Junior Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: pretty standard interview, kinda intimidating because my interviewer was very stern. started with a intro to what the department does... 30 word minimum so a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a
Interview Questions: how do you join 2 tables in SQL

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screening then online group teleconference. 
Unorganized but casual. 
Odd redundant questions and unstructured ones that aren't asking a question.
Answered technical questions correctly, polite, and engaged. Avoid mentioning you're an immigrant, as 'fit' becomes an issue quickly.
Interview Questions:
Behavioural questions
Topic-specific questions

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Burnaby, BC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. In 1 week got interviewed in person. The first half was asking about relative experience at previous jobs. The 2nd half was writing a paper test about queries. Paper test was not very difficult.
Interview Questions: Data warehouse concepts

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Don't bother working here.  The interview process had off-colored unprofessional remarks by one of the director who clearly moved up by politiking.  The impression that I got from my interview questions were that of a disorganized organization, people being shuffled around, and lots of politics.   I'd say move on.  greener pastures elsewhere.
Interview Questions: How do you move up in an organization?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an in-person interview with a panel of 3 people who worked in the research group. The questions were straightforward and they were relatively quick with getting back to me about the hiring decision.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially applied for a different position, HR contacted me and asked if I would be more interested in another position that was currently internal.  After forwarding me the job position, I agreed to the interview. The interview was the following day and was a 3 person panel, including HR.  It was a straightforward interview, and noted that they also had other candidates to interview.  By the next day, I was given the job offer, going through the benefits and salary.
Interview Questions: How did you make your personal workload, or department, more efficient?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: 35 minutes of chat about work history. No a lot of questions. Mostly what you did before. It was a fairly short interview. Met 2 gentlemen. Easy going. Not a whole lot of questions.
Interview Questions: No technical questions. Just what you did before.

title: Sharepoint Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two stage interviews, phone and in-person. The phone interview is general stuff... and an in-person interview is a technical test regarding on the SharePoint technologies, .net framework, SQL server, etc.
Interview Questions: What is ghosted and un-ghosted means in SharePoint?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (West Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a skype interview, very nice people - one of them is the manager and the other is another data analyst, asked mainly about your previous experience in dealing with data, coding, and dealing with stakeholders. Interview lasted around 30 - 45 mins. They got back to me after a week. Then I had to provide two references for their reference checks.
Interview Questions: Was there a conflicting experience within your team.

title: Laboratory Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. Situational questions, concerning communication skills, troubleshooting, prioritizing ability, organizations skills, work-life balance, leadership, difficult situations, team-building capabilities. Interview listed a bit over an hour. Was not a difficult interview,as they asked standard job interview questions. Asked if I could think of situations where I was challenged and how I overcame the challenge. Also was asked about difficult people and how to mitigate conflict.
Interview Questions: What are the responsibilities of the role you are applying for?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview in person, four people, ten questions, no computer testing, thourough reference check, background check. 
Hiring process took three months from the day I applied for the position to the actual start date
Interview Questions: Name your top 3 strenghs

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of panel interviews. With a SR. Doctor, HR and SR Admin. Each of the interviews was over an hour. The panel team was very nice and the interview process was professionaland not cold.
Interview Questions: How did I handle a stressful situation and what was the out come.

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: I did two interviews, they mostly talked about past experience and did a data entry testing and typing test.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot about ability to handle stress and how to deal with conflict and ability to multi-task.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: One interview. Scenario questions. Be prepared to be asked how to deal with clients like Medical Doctors, Dentists, and so on.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding your "care" for health care.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume to a recruiter and was hired over the phone.
Interview Questions: It was a phone interview asking if I was available and able

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview
Interview Questions: questions were standard behavioural interview questions as one would expect

title: Transcription Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied for jobs through internal processes.  Testing was done in their main clerical office and consisted of a typing test for speed and accuracy.  you were given three tries to meet the minimum words per minute (60).  My first go at it was 100% accuracy and 82 words per minute so they waived the other two tries.  Then I answered a multiple choice test on prefixes and suffixes of medical terms.  Third phase was a basic grammar test consisting of where the quotation mark would go in (two weeks' time, one week's duration).  After the testing had been done, it was evaluated and then you were brought into their office for the results and whether or not you were hired, when/if you started and what shifts you preferred.
Interview Questions: Asking what I did in my social life was a bit surprising.  Did not understand why they needed to know what hobbies I had as it was not relevant to the work I was applying for.

title: Client Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an hour-long interview with the department manager and two senior analysts. It was a fairly standard interview discussing the various technologies employed by the site and my experience with them, as well as my ability to pick up new information.
Interview Questions: How do you find out about technologies you aren't familiar with?

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Provincial Health Services Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: All behavioural questions. Just wanted to know what your education background was, your goal and why you were interested in applying. They provide training afterwards for the technical. Perhaps a bit biased on the whole process as I was referred by someone from the company. Really is an easy interview. They care more about the fit rather than your skills. Skill cap basically just involves knowing how to use Excel, copy, paste and data entry so it's good to mention your typing speed. Anything about 50 wpm and you should definitely mention it.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume.
